snippet: The draft deal would, for the first time in history, commit every nation to cutting its greenhouse gas emissions, but it would still fall far short of what scientists say is needed.
abstract: Negotiators from around the world haggle over final elements of United Nations climate change agreement in Peru; agreement would, for first time, commit every nation to cutting its greenhouse gas emissions, but still falls short of what is needed to stave off dangerous and costly early impacts of global warming.
lead_paragraph: The draft deal would, for the first time in history, commit every nation to cutting its greenhouse gas emissions, but it would still fall far short of what scientists say is needed.

headline.main: Nations Plod Forward on Climate Change Accord
headline.print_headline: Nations Plod Forward on Climate Change Accord
